results.description:

By becoming a part of Devexperts, you’ll become a part of a company that fosters self-improvement and actively seeks out-of-the-box ideas. Our teams work together to create the next generation of financial software solutions. We welcome all candidates who believe, as we do, that innovation is grounded in education.

This experienced design professional will support the Marketing department and create art for projects such as corporate website, product websites, blog, landing pages, online advertising campaigns, SMM, emails, etc.

As a part of our team, you will:

results.title: Product Designer, Design Tools
results.description:
Company Description

We believe that now is a critical time to reevaluate the impact of the spaces we depend on to live, work, and play. Sustainable building at a global scale requires better tools and technology for the people designing, building, and operating our spaces. Outer Labs brings modern human-centric design together with the latest technology to radically improve the way real estate, architecture, and construction professionals make decisions. 

Some questions we find ourselves asking: ​How can we help an architect explore thousands of ideas in the time it currently takes to explore one? How can software help us optimize the quality of space for usability while reducing the cost and resources required to build?​ How do encourage reusable solutions that can be manufactured more sustainably and efficiently? 

Answers to these questions require deep expertise in design and engineering that comes from every level of our company. This is why we’ve invested deeply in building a culture that empowers its employees to do great work and directly shape the future of its products. We want smart, creative, and intentional individuals to be part of our core team. Are you in?
 



Job Description

As a Product Designer for Design Tools, you’ll work on a wide variety of challenging problems across a portfolio of clients and internal R+D efforts. Your core focus will be creating design tools that other design professionals in the AEC industry are using for conceptual building design and decision-making.

You’ll work directly with our clients who own and operate large occupant-focused real estate portfolios. You’ll leverage the insight of our product managers and strategists to build a point of view for the user, then bring your designs to life with our world-class engineering team using the latest and greatest technology. As part of a growing team, you’ll also get to shape the design culture at Outer Labs and directly influence the process of design and innovation.



Qualifications

Responsibilities

  • Coordinate with Product Strategists to gather design research and market analysis for use in addressing stakeholder perspectives
  • Partner with Product Management, Product Strategy, and Engineering project team members to develop a user-centric point of view for the product.
  • Express design intent with high-quality mockups and clickable prototypes that embody the end-to-end user journey.
  • Leverage the full range of design expertise at Outer Labs by working closely with other designers to sharpen your intuition and iterate through your designs.
  • Facilitate the handoff of design requirements, clickable prototypes, and assets to developers by working closely with Product Managers and Engineering lead.
  • Advocate for user experience, field questions, and make adjustments as you work throughout the implementation phase.
  • Ensure the final result provides the intended value to stakeholders by responding to feedback and making adjustments as needed.


Required Skills

  • Relevant experience and portfolio working as a Product Designer, User Experience (UX) Designer, or similar role
  • Deep knowledge of user experience research and market analysis frameworks
  • Experience building and iterating on user journeys from design research
  • Experience wireframing, designing and prototyping in Figma, or similar application
  • Excellent eye for aesthetic design and latest design trends
  • Understanding of UX patterns and ability to work with Design Systems
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
  • Driven by curiosity with exceptional attention to detail
  • Preference for fast-paced iteration, deadlines, and budgets
  • Experience with AEC industry is preferred
     


Additional Information


Benefits: 

  • Healthcare, dental, and vision insurance for employee & dependents.  We cover 85% of the cost for employee, and 75% of the cost for dependents
  • 401K with matching up to 4% of your salary
  • Paid parental leave for all new parents
  • Unlimited PTO
  • 11 paid company holidays
  • Computer and home office setup with phone and internet paid for up to $100 each.
  • Annual stipend for education and professional development
  • 100% remote working

Outer Labs provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

results.title: Concept Artist
results.description:
Methodical Games is a newly formed studio built around a fundamental set of ideals; a lean talented team, direct cross-discipline collaboration, quick iteration, and developer-driven processes. Our goal is to foster a haven for developers to push the bounds of their craft and collaborate directly with other creative minds. As our name suggests, we pride ourselves on a detail oriented approach to game development with a focus on meticulously crafted gameplay. You might even call it an obsession. We’re seeking passionate individuals from all walks of life to join us in building something great.

 

We are looking for a versatile and creative Concept Artist to help define the artistic style for a new IP built in Unreal Engine 5. Our ideal candidate will inspire the team by exploring setting, tone, and mood through original concept art that is visually cohesive and in line with the game direction.

 

Responsibilities

  • Use traditional and technological approaches to create designs and storyboards in 2D and 3D through drawing and painting.

  • Interpret initial ideas and quickly sketch drafts for review.

  • Curate reference and develop mood boards.

  • Collaborate with the Art Director and team to develop style guides for environments, characters, weapons, armor, props, and other in-game assets.

  • Proactively engage with all departments to align with high-level priorities and maintain strong lines of communication.

  • Support with textures and matte paintings for in-game use on characters, environments, and user interfaces.

  • Play and give feedback on the game. Your voice matters.

 

Qualifications

  • 2+ years of professional experience.

  • A portfolio of work demonstrating your strong artistic imagination and storytelling ability.

  • Impeccable understanding of artistic fundamentals such as perspective, anatomy, composition, color theory, lighting, form, shape, and texture.

  • Research skills and an exceptional imagination to create images of characters and places that don't yet exist.

  • A developed eye for visual mood as it relates to storytelling.

  • Strong knowledge of influential styles and appeal.

  • Confident using creative tools (Photoshop, Maya, etc).

  • Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with the team.

  • Excellent time management skills, to sketch and adapt images quickly within tight deadlines.

  • Passion for making and playing games.

 

Nice to Have

  • Game development experience.

  • 3D art skills.

  • Graphic design experience.

  • Experience with Adobe Substance suite.

 

Not an exact match for this role? We’d still love to hear from you! Visit our Careers Page and fill out the Open Application to apply.

 

How we work

  • Methodical Games is a remote hybrid studio with an office in Raleigh, North Carolina. We are building an office first culture centered around collaboration, but we are open to fully remote work depending on the position and candidate.

  • Everyone is a hands-on contributor and we believe in leading by example.

  • We’re a small cross-discipline team communicating directly with one another.

  • It is important to us to maintain an inclusive environment where everyone feels empowered to be themselves and do their best work.

 

What we offer

  • Competitive salary.

  • Generous equity and profit sharing.

  • Unlimited paid time off, Summer and Winter breaks.

  • Excellent health, dental, and vision insurance with 100% of premiums covered for employees.

  • 401(k) retirement plan and Flex Spending accounts.

  • Relocation assistance to the Raleigh area.

  • Centrally located office minutes from downtown Raleigh, Cary, and Durham. Walk to PNC Arena (home of the Carolina Hurricanes). Garage parking with free EV charging!

results.title: Senior UX Programmer - Prototyper
results.description:
Masterpiece Studio makes it effortless to create 3D content from concept to animation. We harness the power of virtual reality and machine learning to let creatives easily create in 3D.

 

Our software makes it easy to create 3D content for games, animation, and education today, but just as important, our software is a fundamental requirement to build the metaverse of tomorrow.

 

Our mission is to help people easily create 3D content of whatever they can imagine.

 

We are looking for team members that are creative, fearless, collaborative, and problem solvers who want to help us create the new world of 3D content creation.

 

The Role

In this role, the Senior User Interface Programmer-Prototyper will create rapid prototypes to allow fast iteration and evaluation of new experimental UX concepts. This will include new interaction paradigms and tool affordances.

As a member of our UX team, you will work cross-functionally to rapidly prototype innovative UX solutions that make 3D creation in an immersive environment intuitive and natural. Once the functionalities feel right, you will be asked to re-code them for integration into the main application.

Our Senior User Interface Programmer-Prototyper will be accountable for activities including:

  • Creating prototypes in Unity that solve UX issues or innovate new approaches for 3D creation in VR
  • Providing translated functional and efficient code from prototypes to the production code base
  • Maintaining and improving codebase to be accessible to Designers for adjustments
  • Archival of Prototypes codebase for later use
  • Participating in the UX team’s ideation, design, and research process

 

The Day to Day
We suspect our next hire will accomplish their goals by:

  • Creating prototypes in Unity that can be tested, adjusted, and archived to be re-used later in time
  • Building UI code base to be evolved over time
  • Maintaining UI code to be regularly submitted to the main development pipeline and keeping a prototype archive alive.
  • Communicating closely with development teams to understand what coding best practices they can employ
  • Working with UX Lead, Product Manager, UX team, and Development team to understand the product goals, known issues, and feedback
  • Working with the UX Team to identify the highest value UX problems to solve and developing plans for the rapid prototypes
  • Fostering a strong, collaborative design practice and helping in the creation of a thriving culture of inclusion and belonging
  • Applying a user-centered design approach and rapidly helping to test and iterate on designs if needed

What we believe our next hire will bring to the business:

  • 5+ years of experience in Unity UI design and construction for XR apps
  • Demonstrated strong expertise in:
    • Unity 2020+
    • VR-XR interaction toolkit
    • Unity UI Toolkit/UI builder
    • Unity XML and USS
  • Communication and presentation skills
  • XR UI design and construction for PC and Android

Familiar with:

  • User testing process
  • Unity Animation (technical)
  • 3D formats in Unity (technical)
  • Unity Shaders & Shadergraph technical knowledge
  • Rapid prototyping vs production

It would be beneficial (though not required) if you have a working knowledge of:

  • HTML and CSS
  • Agile Scrum, XP, and/or Continuous Delivery
  • Figma and Miro
  • Firebase
  • Event and data-driven architectures

In a perfect world (though also not required), you would be familiar with:

  • Understanding of 3D asset creation and animation (Blender, ZBrush, Maya, MotionBuilder, etc)

 

What You’ll Get By Joining Our Team

You will have the chance to lead an industry.
Many people only dream of having the opportunity to set the standard in art, tech, and business – but if you have the talent, Masterpiece has the power to make it your new normal. We work in a space where things are constantly changing, which means you’ll always have a new puzzle to solve. If you’re inspired by overcoming the impossible with stellar teammates by your side, Masterpiece is the place to bring your best to even better.

You will feel the impact of your work.
At Masterpiece, you have the power to shape your career, doing the things you love most on projects with serious impact. We pride ourselves on pushing boundaries, so we encourage conversations about how to do things better– and when it’s your turn to speak up, this team will always have your back.

You will be a lifelong learner.
Joining the Masterpiece team means committing to continuous development and curiosity. After all, it’s hard to stay stagnant in an industry as dynamic as ours. We’ll work with you to find the common ground between our overarching goals and your personal interests, so you can expand your skill set to a whole new level.

Perks

  • Shape the future of VR creation for gaming, animation, and the metaverse
  • Partner with the biggest players in tech
  • Freedom to build and innovate beyond your job description
  • Growth opportunities to continue to develop your skills
  • Remote work opportunities

Masterpiece Studio is bringing cutting-edge machine learning and cutting-edge VR technologies together to enable hundreds of millions of people to create 3D content. This tight-knit team of strong individuals is working together to make a massive impact and change an industry.

 

Masterpiece Studios is years ahead of anybody else in the world, leading an industry with a simplified full solution to make real-time 3D content. With many of the top companies in the world partnering with us, there is an immense opportunity to grow.

“Against all odds, people thought it couldn’t be done, but this passionate team came together, and found a way to break through, to have breakthrough technology and make it all work.” - Jon Gagne, CEO of Masterpiece Studio

We’re taking on the Goliaths of the world– and we're winning.


EEOC

Masterpiece Studio is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are given consideration regardless of race, religion, colour, gender, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, marital status, citizenship status, disability, veteran status, or any other protected class as provided in applicable employment laws. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at careers (at) masterpiecestudio (dot) com.

results.title: Senior Weapon Artist
results.description:
Counterplay Games is looking for a Senior Weapon Artist for our next-gen PC and Console AAA game currently being developed using Unreal Engine. As the a Senior Weapon Artist , you will be responsible for faithfully creating weapons from real-world references as well as developing them from scratch based on concept art. You will also be responsible for supervising and mentoring junior members of the weapon art team, and collaborating with other stakeholders to ensure that all weapons achieve the quality bar established by the Weapons Lead. 

Responsibilities:

  • Deliver AAA quality models that are functional and error free
  • Work from a combination of real-world reference and original concept art
  • Interact and collaborate with team members from different departments (design, tech-art, animation, etc.)
  • Supervise and mentor junior artists on the team
  • Participate in creating and maintaining weapon content workflows that are efficient and scalable
  • Demonstrate a desire to learn and grow professionally. 

Skills & Requirements:

  • 5+ years experience in game development and hardsurface asset creation
  • Expert knowledge of current generation game art techniques and dependencies
  • Strong understanding of PBR texture workflow
  • Strong communication and writing skills.
  • Strong knowledge of Unreal or equivalent real-time game engines

Bonus:

  • Experience using Fusion 360
  • Interest and passion for contemporary firearms and how they work

results.title: Senior Product Designer
results.description:
About NoRedInk
It has never been more important that students around the world have the tools and support to learn through digital instruction. NoRedInk helps students become better writers in more than 60% of middle and high schools in the U.S. Our adaptive curriculum engages learners by personalizing exercises to their interests, guiding them step-by-step through the writing process, and boosting their skills through differentiated practice. We’re relentlessly focused on helping all students harness the power of the written word.
 
About the Role
NoRedInk is looking for a product designer to help us achieve our mission of unlocking every writer’s potential. In this role, you’ll serve as the dedicated designer for two of our cross-functional feature teams: 1) Product Growth and 2) Learning Experience. Every feature team at NoRedInk owns a significant aspect of our strategy and product, and you’ll work closely with product managers, engineers, curriculum specialists, and other key stakeholders to build innovative software solutions that improve the lives of our users.
 
More specifically, the product designer is responsible for owning the end-to-end design strategy and solutions for each of their product areas by using design thinking, creative problem solving, and visual design craft to deliver meaningful experiences for our students, teachers, and administrators. All of our product designers are “generalists,” meaning that they drive research, information architecture, interaction design, visual design, prototyping, and everything in between.
 
Design at NoRedInk sits within the larger product team, consisting of product managers and product designers. The design team itself is small but mighty, currently consisting of two other product designers.  As the third member of this team, you’ll be a partner in up-leveling the role of design at NoRedInk by assuming the highest level of ownership over our design system, direction, and processes.
 
In this role, you will:
  • Own end-to-end design for two product areas: Product Growth and Learning Experience.
  • Drive research, information architecture, interaction design, visual design, prototyping, and usability testing for new features and experiments.
  • Partner with product managers, engineers, curriculum specialists, and stakeholders from other departments to define, design, and build features that delight users
  • Drive improvements to our product’s overall design, tooling, and processes, and contribute to maintaining and growing our design system
 
About You:
  • 7+ years relevant experience on an in-house product design team 
  • Experience driving end-to-end design for critical, complex projects that both solve user needs and achieve business outcomes
  • Strong across information architecture, interaction design, visual design, and prototyping
  • Experience working on an agile team with product managers and engineers
  • Exceptional written, verbal, and visual communication skills
  • Ability to independently manage deliverables and set expectations with clear communication, planning, and estimated timelines
  • Excellent at giving and receiving design feedback 
  • Passion for K-12 education and a deep commitment to improving outcomes for students and educators
 
What NoRedInk Offers:
  • A competitive salary and equity package in a high-growth, well-funded startup with massive traction
  • Excellent health, vision, and dental benefits (U.S. Only)
  • A remote-first culture that allows for flexible hours (We were big on remote before COVID!)
  • A relaxed and flexible PTO policy and paid parental leave
  • 401(k) (U.S. Only)
  • LinkedIn Learning subscription with unlimited access to thousands of expert-led online courses
  • Team retreats and events to connect with fun, talented coworkers
  • Consistent modeling of our company’s core values
  • The ability to help millions of students and teachers and address a critical societal need
 
About NoRedInk:
NoRedInk helps students in over 60% of US school districts become better writers. Our deeply engaging, adaptive curriculum personalizes exercises to kids' interests, guides them through the writing process with instructional support, and boosts their skills through targeted practice. Students have completed over 10 billion exercises on our site, and our mission is to help all students harness the power of the written word.
 
Check out our press page, including our 2-minute pitch on NBC and articles in The Washington Post, Wall Street Journal, and Forbes.
 
NoRedInk believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success, and we seek to recruit, develop, and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. At NoRedInk, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. 
 
Compensation at NoRedInk is robust and includes a full range of benefits, unlimited PTO, monthly co-working stipends, an initial home-office set up stipend, and generous equity. Our salary ranges are based on location specific market data and internal parity. For New York City, the salary range for this role is $160,000.00 - $175,000.00. Please know that if you are invited to speak with a recruiter at NoRedInk, they will have an open discussion about compensation during your first call to ensure alignment. 
 
*Note: Agencies or other third-party recruiters may not submit unsolicited candidate resumes or their information to any NoRedInk employee, including a NoRedInk Recruiter, unless a contract is signed and you are given permission by the Talent Acquisition team to work on a job opening.

results.title: Senior Product Designer
results.description:
Userpilot is a leading product engagement and analytics software that is used by 700+ companies worldwide. Our pioneering event-based tracking solution gives product teams the ability to gain insights into how to best acquire, convert, and retain their users with the additional help of user engagement and feedback tools.

Userpilot is looking for a Senior Product Designer as follows:

Responsibilities

  • Work with product leadership to craft, refine, implement, and communicate design vision and strategy across the organization.
  • Produce high-quality UX design solutions through wireframes, visual and graphic designs, flow diagrams, storyboards, site maps, and prototypes.
  • Collaborate closely with product, business, and engineering partners in an agile environment.
  • Create prototypes for new product ideas & test these ideas before implementing.
  • Effectively communicate and evangelize design thinking throughout the organization with compelling storytelling.
  • Providing advice and guidance on the implementation of UX research methodologies and testing activities in order to analyze and predict user behavior.
  • Deliver innovative design experiences to our customers at each stage of their journey.
  • Ensure the delivery of a consistent user experience across the product

Requirements

  • You have at least 3 years of design experience.
  • You have an online portfolio of professional UI/UX design work showcasing an appetite for designs that push boundaries and take risks.
  • You find and craft elegant but practical solutions to design challenges.
  • You're proficient in design and prototyping software such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe Suite, or Invision.
  • You’re energized by hands-on work: sketching concepts, defining flows, building prototypes, or polishing final designs.
  • You have previous experience working with Product Management and Engineering teams.
  • You have a broad range of skills with strengths in visual product design.
  • You’re constantly looking to hone your design instinct through user feedback, user research, contextual interviews, and competitive/analogous research.
  • You’re proactive, creative, adaptable, and collaborative. You love wrestling with problems.
  • You quickly create a range of engaging, elegant, easy-to-use, and technically-feasible ideas.

results.title: UI/UX Designer
results.description:
We are looking for an experienced UI/UX Designer to turn our software into easy-to-use products for our clients. UI/UX Designer responsibilities include gathering user requirements, designing graphic elements and building navigation components. To be successful in this role, you should have several years of experience in designing powerful and intuitive UI/UX designs and you should be very familiar with design software and wire frame tools.

If you also have a portfolio of professional design projects that includes work with web/mobile applications, we’d like to meet you. Ultimately, you’ll create both functional and appealing features that address our clients’ needs and help us grow our customer base.


Responsibilities
  • Lead our UX/UI design efforts and build world class interfaces for our products.
  • Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineers
  • Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps
  • Design graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs and widgets
  • Develop UI mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like
  • Create original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches and tables)
  • Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness)
  • Conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback

Requirements

  • Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role
  • Several years of expertise in designing powerful but yet intuitive UI/UX Designs
  • Portfolio of design projects
  • Knowledge of wireframe tools (e.g. Wireframe.cc and InVision)
  • Up-to-date knowledge of design software like Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop
  • Team spirit; strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders
  • Good time-management skills
  • BSc in Design, Computer Science or relevant field
  • Proficieny in CSS is a plus

Benefits

  • Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
  • Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
  • Training & Development
  • Work From Home

results.title: Senior Product Designer
results.description:
Fuel50 are leaders in the space of career discovery and mobility within organisations and have pioneered our way there using ML and AI at the core of our product strategy. This is an opportunity to join a company who are building products that transform the people experience and who are fully bought in to the value that great product design contributes to their success.

We are looking for a Senior Product Designer to join our Product team. Reporting to the Design Lead, you will be working closely with a Product Manager as well as our Engineering team and together you will own a part of Fuel50, ship solutions to challenging problems and get feedback directly from our customers.

Being successful in this role will see you work across the spectrum of product design, from quickly creating sketches and prototypes to shape solutions to problems, or running user research alongside your team’s product manager, to taking these insights through ideation into shipped product with your product development team.

The ideal candidate for this role will thrive in a small team where you can make a big impact. You are confident in your toolkit and experience, and you also love to pick up new skills and knowledge. In addition, you have an innate drive to be successful. As a foundational member of a scaling start-up, you want to take the initiative and solve big problems.

Key Role Responsibilities:

  • Act as a leader within your product squad, collaborating to make your work and the whole team thrive.
  • Work through design problems from beginning to end, often partnering with designers on other teams to create holistic experiences.
  • Sketch and prototype ideas to quickly assess viability and make design directions clear and concrete for the whole team, helping the team to make better decisions.
  • Iterate your designs based on testing and feedback from our customers and from the whole team.
  • Facilitate design-thinking and problem-solving within your Product Squad and between this team and the other product, go-to-market and customer success teams they partner with.
  • Work closely with engineers as they build and ship ideas.
  • Own the success or failure of your design work and initiate design sprints to innovate or improve upon shipped work.

Requirements

  • Experienced in designing digital products and systems, not just websites. You have helped ship digital products.
  • Design connected modular systems, not just disparate user interfaces.
  • Have a strong service design mentality and understand the broader landscape of the product and impact that your work can bring.
  • Being able to prototype to learn and are comfortable choosing and using the right level of fidelity, from simple sketches to high-fidelity functional prototypes in Figma, Sketch, etc.
  • Have a strong appreciation of the entire product development process, and can take a concept from a whiteboard sketch, through to a fully-realised user experience with detailed UI.
  • You have the ability to create prototypes using Framer, Keynote, HTML/CSS/JS, etc.
  • Strong understanding of quantitative data and are comfortable working alongside product managers and UX researchers in refining your design work.
  • Excellent communicator of design work and the rationale behind proposals.
  • You are adept at coordinating work across multiple teams and bringing together ideas from various stakeholder groups, both in and out of R&D.
  • Previous experience working on products that incorporated ML or AI elements would be advantageous.

About Fuel50

Fuel50 is an international, high-growth tech company. Our award-winning AI talent marketplace platform exists to improve the lives and careers of people everywhere by empowering forward-thinking companies to deploy career growth and talent mobility initiatives to attract and retain talent while boosting engagement and productivity. In other words, we are at the forefront of changing how people work and how organizations empower their people.

Our tech is global and has touched careers across 100+ companies in 13+ languages and 25+ countries. Our clients are some of the biggest brands in their respective industries. And, most importantly, we practice what we preach and believe everyone should be in a job they love (including you!).

Fuel50 is immensely proud of our strong team culture, where our people (or “Fuellies”) come first. Our vision and values are inclusive and transparent and built upon quarterly business objectives that drive our growth, encourage goal setting, and celebrate milestones every step of the way.

The Fuel50 vision has resonated with investors across NZ, Australia, UK, and the USA - supporting our global growth and helping us become the pioneers in this fast-growing talent space.

We are also a socially responsible company. We work with charities that help women and minority groups land on their feet through career coaching and support.

Benefits

As well as our day-to-day responsibilities, all Fuellies play an integral part in growing our culture with us and ensuring that Fuel50 remains an inspirational and amazing place to work. Some additional benefits are:

  • Day off on your birthday, your Fuel50 anniversary and a companywide celebration day.
  • Employee Stock Options Plan (ESOP).
  • Flexible working times and remote working (as above) - we're very supportive of school commitments, traveling in off-peak hours, looking after the kids, and all that jazz.
  • Investing in you with career and development planning, using our very own Fuel50 software and online Fuellie University.
  • A very progressive parental leave policy - get extra flexibility and time off on top of what your local government already mandates.
  • Comprehensive fully subsidised Health Insurance with Southern Cross.
  • Family and friends pizza nights once a month (if you live nearby HQ) - bring your best mate, significant other, kids, or yourself for pizza, table tennis, and pool.

What is it like to be a Fuellie?

We know that having the right people with the right attitude and behavior is a big part of what makes us successful. Living our values is an important part of being successful in this role.

  • We have a culture around continuous (but super friendly) feedback and recognition - be part of a family-like team that is working towards a common goal and helping each other every step of the way.
  • We have #SuperheroAwards at every quarterly sprint meeting and every weekly team meeting includes spontaneous recognition and shout-outs across the business.
  • We'll have your back when you need help - your colleagues want to see you succeed and work hard to help you do so.
  • We work hard and deliver amazing results to our clients - when you see our amazing feedback, you'll be proud to be a Fuellie.
  • Amazing coffee - it really is, some of our team have even come to HQ on a Saturday just to get their fix!

Application Process

If this sounds like you, then please apply. If you’re not sure you're ready or perhaps you don't meet all requirements yet, please apply anyway. We'll review every application that we get.

Applications close on Sunday 11 December

This role is based in New Zealand, as a result candidates must hold the relevant right to work in NZ i.e. Citizenship or a work visa at time of application.

results.title: Motion Graphics Designer
results.description:
Levitate Foundry is an award-winning eCommerce growth marketing firm and early-stage brand foundry. We work with brands across CPG/CE/Beauty/Wellness/Health/Fashion, in both Hardlines and Softlines categories, across the world, to implement innovative growth marketing strategies and executional media buying for our clients. We also have a brand strategy and UX/UI arm (including design, creative, and advertising production teams). We are looking for an experienced marketing professional to lead Account Management and Strategy Implementation for Performance Creative, reporting to the Director of Content and Performance Creative. Find past brands we've worked with at: www.levitatefoundry.com.

Requirements

  • Lead performance creative initiatives and produce high volume of ad creative to drive measurable results for brand adoption and customer acquisition
  • Create videos and gifs for a wide range of clients
  • Support the day-to-day account management of our Creative clients and take full ownership on all account activities.
  • Propose, develop, design, and manage creative templates, mockups, and other design/production efficiencies to be shared with other designers and external partners, as needed.
  • Strategically translate business opportunities into advertising and performance content strategies to effectively communicate to customers throughout their journey.
  • Pivoting to change course or adjust ideas to address new feedback and guidance
  • Understand what’s working in current ads and why
  • Writing compelling creative briefs and working closely with creative teams to develop work that makes an impact
  • Guide the advertising creative process, and lead the team to deliver on the winning creative
  • Ideate best concepts and encourage others to contribute winning ideas
  • Check in and manage projects as they move through the creative and media teams
  • Send updates and conduct calls with the accounts assigned to ensure consistent communication
  • Ensure that clients are delivering all assets and responses per timeline


What You Bring

  • Experience in Performance Creative working on creative assets for Meta, YouTube, TikTok, Pinterest, and Twitter
  • You have 1-2 years of minimum experience at different eCommerce or digitally native brands, at a digital marketing agency, or in a social media marketing and/or brand partnerships role
  • Proficiency in all relevant design software, including but not limited to Adobe Creative Cloud [Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop, Lightroom, XD—familiarity with Dimension, Premiere Pro, and After Effects are a plus], Sketch, Figma, Keynote, G Suite applications, etc.
  • Experience with a project management platform like Asana or monday.com
  • Experience across a variety of industries and verticals with the ability to bridge a connection between business needs, creative vision, and consumer interests.
  • Experience working with Instagram, Facebook, Google, Twitter, YouTube, Pinterest, etc. and understanding their analytics/insights
  • You have knowledge of online and offline marketing, managing and building community and an active following, creative best practices, and have the ability to be creative
  • You have good Client services skills and the ability to present your thoughts and presentations effectively
  • Passion for smart and engaging storytelling, social listening, and creating meaningful or empowering experiences for a diverse audience
  • Highly organized, detail-oriented and media-savvy
  • You are able to work in a fast-paced, exciting environment and across external and internal teams to deliver top results to Clients. You are a team player, smart, adapt well to change, and have a positive attitude

Benefits

  • Competitive Salary
  • Fully Remote Workplace
  • Medical, Dental & Vision
  • 401k
  • Life
  • PTO Policy

results.title: Senior Product Designer
results.description:
We are ThinkShout, a fully distributed, certified B Corp dedicated to delivering exceptional web development, design, user experience, and strategy to the nonprofits and forward-thinking organizations that inspire us.

We're looking for a Senior Product Designer to lead project work, inspire our clients, and engage in shaping our design team in a time of critical department growth.. User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and inspiring communication. You’ll collaborate with fellow designers and departments to create innovative design solutions that have a greater impact for our clients.

Requirements

Qualifications:
  • 5+ years of relevant industry experience, designing large-scale websites and engaging digital products
  • A visual thinker with strong color, typographic, and UX/UI skills with a knack for design systems
  • Advanced level of proficiency with design programs like Figma and Adobe Creative Suite
  • Knowledge of how designs are applied in HTML and CSS as well as CMS platforms; Wordpress and Drupal are a plus
  • A deep understanding of accessible, inclusive and user-centered design practices
  • An awareness of the inherent white supremacy of design thinking and actively making efforts to decolonize one’s individual design practice
  • Strong communication skills, ability to present and defend work to peers and executive-level stakeholders
  • Experience working with existing brands and design systems in order to maintain brand voice and visual identity; Brand design experience a plus
  • Experience creating reusable components & design patterns to scale and fit variety of content and technical requirements as well as in-line with project budgets
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and an agile self-starter, able to contribute to projects with varying levels of direction, and pivot flexibly as project plans shift
  • Experience working independently and on multidisciplinary teams, and collaborating with strategists, developers and other designers in supporting large-scale projects
  • Dedication and self-management skills; Experience mentoring fellow designers a plus

Bonus Points:
  • Front-end development experience
  • Motion, video, interactive storytelling examples

Essential Responsibilities:
  • Owning and leading projects while collaborating closely with strategists, developers, and other designers to ideate, iterate, and bring innovative and intuitive solutions to the table
  • Building and maintaining creative offerings for ThinkShout's client work, participating in all UX and visual design stages of a project from concept through final hand-off to our development team, and serving as design advisor through implementation
  • Working within established brands and design systems; expanding them where needed
  • Creating, organizing, and documenting all your designs in Figma with extreme detail
  • Managing your time between projects of varying size and complexity with a dedicated focus to elevating your craft

Benefits

The Fine Print

ThinkShout is a fully distributed company and we welcome applications from candidates who have the unrestricted right to work in the USA.

ThinkShout is primarily a time and materials agency. In the role of Senior Product Designer, there is a weekly expectation of 30 billable hours. We work hard to maintain a 40 hour work week and we’re committed to supporting flexible schedules.

The salary band for this position is $80-105k. In addition, we offer a comprehensive benefits package, including:

  • Health insurance with dental, vision, and alternative care
  • Company funded Health Reimbursement Account
  • 401k with a 3% company contribution and no matching requirement
  • Quarterly Profit Share program
  • Life insurance and short term disability insurance
  • Paid Family and Medical Leave
  • 32 days of PTO annually, including holidays
  • Paid sabbatical after 5 years with the company
  • Professional development funds
  • Excellent management support and a well thought-out yearly review process


ThinkShout is made up of people with a variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. We recognize that our company isn't as diverse as it should be and we're trying to change that. If you aren't sure whether you qualify, please apply anyway. We would much prefer to have an extra application to consider than for you to screen yourself out. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status or any other differences. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process better (jobs@thinkshout.com). We are happy to accommodate.


Next Steps

Please submit a resume (no more than 2 pages) in PDF format. We request that you do not submit a cover letter. In its place, we have a few questions for you to answer in the job application. These questions will help us learn more about you and are an integral component of the interview process.

If you are selected to move forward, here’s what you can expect:

  • Round 1 is a 25-minute screening call
  • Round 2 is a 55-minute panel interview in which you will present a project from your portfolio followed by a Q&A
  • Round 3 is a 45-minute finalist interview

We are looking to fill this position for a January start date.

Please note that candidates must reside and be eligible to work in the United States.

results.title: UI Design Tutors and Mentors (f/m/d)
results.description:
We created CareerFoundry to help others build their careers while maintaining personal freedom and flexibility. Our 100% online, flexible, mentor/tutor driven courses are setting the standard for globally accessible technical education. Through our online programs, expert tutors and mentors bring students from complete beginners to junior UI designers in 6 months.

We are searching for experienced and passionate UI designers to join our pool of experts. Help define the next generation of design talent by educating and empowering students across the globe while working remotely and around your own schedule!

Your Mission:

Mentoring with CareerFoundry is more than teaching. It’s inspiring newcomers to the field to build, to problem solve, to think like a designer, and to increase their value as professionals.

**Based on your application and experience, we will make a decision on whether the Tutor or Mentor role is the perfect fit for you.

Mentor role:

Students need more than help and experience to master the necessary skills, they need inspiration and motivation to keep them focused along the way. You're their point of entry into a new industry, so they’ll want to hear about challenges you have overcome and what the role is really like on a day-to-day basis.

Tasks:

  • Reviewing your students’ work through the CareerFoundry platform on a regular basis with a view on how it would fit into an industry-ready portfolio.
  • Be available for 1-to-1 video calls to help prepare your students entry into their new industry.
  • Suggesting supplemental learning materials and personal insights in areas where students are struggling.
  • Teaming up with a tutor to answer more advanced queries or for a higher level of troubleshooting.
  • Responding to students within < 48 hours.

Tutor role:

Tutors give vital feedback on assignments through written reviews guided by our course curriculum and rubrics. When students are struggling with understanding a key area, tutors are there to support and encourage them, sharing resources and providing insights into the industry.

Tasks:

  • Regularly reviewing student exercises submitted through the CareerFoundry platform.
  • Submission reviews and checking for fundamental understanding of concepts.
  • Suggesting supplemental learning materials and personal insights in areas where students are struggling.
  • Working with a mentor who will advise the student specifically on career-related topics and support you as a tutor.
  • Responding to students within < 24 hours.

Requirements

To succeed, you must enjoy sharing your knowledge and be willing to work with students from beginner level onwards.

Mentor role:

  • Experience in the field as a Senior UI Designer, Creative Lead, Product Design Lead, Art Director, and a demonstrable track record showcasing your work for a variety of clients and companies.
  • A portfolio demonstrating your skill and examples of professional projects. Professional references may be required.
  • Previous experience in mentorship or tutoring is preferred. You must demonstrate an understanding of how to support beginners, have time and patience and a strong desire to guide people along their career path in this field.
  • Knowledge of the latest development tools and trends, a broad network of experts in the field and an in-depth understanding of industry practices.
  • Fluent in English.

Tutor role:

  • 2+ years experience in the field, working as a (Junior to Mid-Level) UI designer.
  • A great portfolio.
  • In depth knowledge of industry best practices.
  • A strong desire to help others.
  • Fluent in English.

Benefits

  • 100% Remote and flexible - work from anywhere with an internet connection, and around your schedule.
  • A freelance contract with a competitive rate.
  • Shape the industry by developing the next generation of designers.
  • Resume gold – mentoring experience is highly sought after by employers.

CareerFoundry is an equal opportunity employer. It is our commitment that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. We encourage in particular BiPoC, Migrants, people from under-represented communities, people who identify as queer, trans, and/ or intersex, people
with chronic illnesses, and people with disabilities to apply!


For inquiries please contact the team at talent.instructors@careerfoundry.com

We're looking forward to hearing from you!

results.title: UX Designer
results.description:
About Grio

Founded in 2008, Grio prides itself in being a premier full-service web and mobile software consulting agency based in San Francisco, CA. So, why join Grio? As a remote-work first company, Grio is committed to hiring teams with diverse backgrounds for the purpose of promoting creativity, and believes great ideas come from teams with various perspectives. This means you get to work with team members located across the globe – from Mexico City to New York and everything in between.

Our employees boast about the positive collaboration they experience with their teammates and the company’s commitment to work/life flexibility. This speaks volumes to Grio’s year over year growth , repeat clients, and even repeat employees! We take an empathic approach to ensure that we’re delivering the best possible products to our clients, and use that same lens to create a culture of engagement for our employees.

About the Role

Grio is looking for a fully remote, full-time, UX Designer to join our design team. In this role, you will have an exciting opportunity to work on interesting and complex problems across a variety of industries. This is what to expect during your first year with Grio as a UX Designer:

  • You will complete 3-4 UX projects for a variety of clients and industries including but not limited to Insurance, Architecture, Ecommerce, and Manufacturing.
  • You will learn how Grio project teams of designers, product and project managers, QA engineers, and software developers work together to deliver high quality products and solutions to clients.
  • You will build a relationship with the Grio design team through team meetings and project work. The design team is a close knit group of designers who encourage, support, and learn from each other.
  • You will meet Grio employees through project work, All Hands meetings, and other Grio sponsored virtual and in-person social activities.
  • You will maintain Grio’s high standards of communication with your ability to actively listen to clients to strengthen relationships and build trust.

Requirements

About You

You ideally have previous experience working with clients or in a design agency, can work independently and autonomously, pivot easily and run in a different direction when needed, and can receive constructive feedback without losing momentum. We are seeking someone who enjoys simplifying complex workflows, advocating for users, has problem-solving and active listening skills with the ability to ask critical questions of clients, and can communicate designs and their nuances to engineers and stakeholders. You should have strong experience working with a distributed workforce in a highly-collaborative environment. To be considered, please answer the screening questions and share your resume. A portfolio is optional to apply.

  • 4+ years of experience in a client-facing role, preferably in an agency setting, with proven success communicating design concepts, rationale, and technical terminology to clients
  • Extensive experience with the following:
    • Planning interviews and user testing, moderating feedback sessions, analysis, and applying the insights to UX deliverables
    • Creating UX deliverables such as site maps, user flows, and both low- and high- fidelity wireframes
    • Designing for web, responsive web, and native mobile platforms
    • Writing UX documentation that allows the development team to implement solutions successfully
    • Collaborating with cross-functional teams (fellow designers, product managers, developers) to create and deliver designs solutions that meet project requirements
  • Experience with Figma

Grio is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. You will not be discriminated against based on your age, race, gender, sexual orientation, sexual identity, religion, disability, veteran status, national origin, marital status or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.

If you love what you do and want to work hard to build innovative software then we encourage you to please apply!

Benefits

  • Enjoy the flexibility of working on different projects, technologies and industries for different clients.
  • 100% paid health and wellness benefits; 50% paid for spouses and dependents.
  • An educational allowance that coincides with the company’s life-long commitment to learning and development for all of its staff.
  • Compensation packages that let you share in the company’s long-term success.
  • A 5% 401(k) company match – that’s free money in your pocket!
  • Sick days & a generous vacation policy – the longer your tenure, the more vacay time you accrue.

results.title: Mid/Senior Technical Artist(s)
results.description:
Company Description

City State Entertainment is an independent video game development studio founded in March 2011, in Fairfax, Virginia, by online gaming pioneer Mark Jacobs and engineer extraordinaire, Andrew Meggs. Several years later, our Seattle studio was founded and is run by another extraordinary engineer, George Davison. The studio embodies an “open office” collaborative process where all team members are expected to contribute to the design and the development process. The team has built a next-generation engine tentatively titled the "Unchained Engine" which is powering their two games in development - Camelot Unchained, a niche RvR old-school MMORPG (currently in Beta) and Final Stand: Ragnarok, a PvE looter-slasher in which teams of any size fight against hordes of NPCs (currently in very Early Access on Steam).



Job Description

We are currently looking for creative and driven technical artists to join us to support our art and rendering team. Our interest includes not just generalist Tech Artists, but also any experienced tech artists with specialities.

Examples:
Tech Artist - Pipeline/tools
Tech Artist - Shaders/Materials
Tech Artist - Animator - Rigging

So if you’re a tech artist with the vision to develop tools, passion for finding technical solutions and improving pipelines or are render focused with drive and skills to develop shaders and material effects, we are interested across the board.

Role and Responsibilities:
Technical Artists are a critical role that will work together with artists and engineers to drive the visual development of our projects forward, with the opportunity to be part of direction and vision, as well as guiding other artists. Collaborating with artists and others roles may include: generating high quality shaders, materials, scripts and rigs. Designs and developing improved content creation pipelines and workflows.



Qualifications

What we are looking for:
• 2 or more years in games development in a technical art role
• Intimately familiar with physically based rendering, shaders (HLSL), and physically based material systems
• Cognizance of new graphics techniques and ability to drive meaningful improvements to the overall graphical quality of the game.
• Experience working with developers to update tools and pipeline processes for artists.
• Solid understanding of Substance Suite, Zbrush, and Maya.
• Experience with optimization for performant art without sacrificing visual fidelity and quality.
• Able to resolve unique technical challenges in creative and novel manner.
• Great time management and ability to work with deadlines and multiple competing priorities.
• Strong communication ability particularly between engineers and artists.



Additional Information

Bonus:
• Strong knowledge of the MMO industry and PC gaming industry
• Able to provide concise critique and feedback to help raise other artists' skill level.
• C++ and/or engineering experience.
• Understanding of the process of rigging and animation creation, as well as animation techniques.


Note: City State Entertainment is hiring for a broad range of positions on a growing team. We have definite skill and task needs, but the eventual division of tasks within the team will depend on the eventual team members. If you’re an outstanding and talented individual whose qualifications fall halfway between two of our listings, we’d still like to hear from you. All candidates must have excellent communication skills. We prefer candidates who can work on-site at either of our Washington DC/Seattle area offices in the U.S.A. Due to COVID-19, all employees are currently working remotely for the time being. Candidates who are hired as "remote only" team members will not ever be required to relocate to either area. We are an emphatically equal-opportunity employer.

results.title: Sr. UX Designer
results.description:
Netomi is an AI-first customer service platform that enables companies to deliver the highest quality customer experiences while significantly reducing cost. Netomi's Relationship Operating System automatically resolves up to 80% of routine customer service inquiries, decreasing resolution time, and increasing customer satisfaction and support quality. The patented, no-code platform works across messaging, chat, email and voice, and understands 100+ languages. Netomi is based in San Francisco and has offices in New York and India.
 
Want to have a direct impact in solving the top challenges businesses face today? Join us!
 
You’ll be responsible for creating and conducting user research, interviews and surveys, and translating them into sitemaps, wireframes and prototypes that will be used by our Engineering team to build a world class product.
 
You will make an impact on the overall design and functionality of the Netomi platform and iterate upon it to ensure a great user experience. You will work closely with Product, Engineering and Customer Sucess teams to help build a leading-edge experience for our customers. Preference will be given to candidates based in the Toronto area.



Responsibilities:
  • Facilitate product design by researching, conceiving, wire-framing, sketching, prototyping, and mocking up user experiences for our platform.
  • Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to existing and new functions and features based on hands-on user research, or by designing options for an A/B test.
  • Work closely with product managers to understand requirements and develop high level and detailed storyboards, mockups and prototypes, to effectively communicate interaction, design, product and user goals.
  • Translate concepts into wireframes and high quality design deliverables  to be used by the engineering team to build products.
  • Work closely with developers to address design implementation challenges.
  • Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions with a user-centered design approach
  • Rapidly test and iterate your designs.
  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
  • Take smart risks and champion new ideas that lead to intuitive user experiences.
  • Act as a UX mentor and guide to our current and future UX designers.
  • Document findings, improvements and processes, as needed.



Requirements:
  • Overall 6+ years of relevant experience working as a UX designer, and 4+ years in B2B SaaS products/platforms, complex enterprise platforms.
  • Proficient in interaction design, user testing, and user research techniques – using research and data to drive high-value product decisions.
  • With a strong attention to detail, you are data driven and use quantitative as well as qualitative data sources to inform your design decisions.
  • Ability to collaborate and communicate effectively with product managers and engineers.
  • Clear communication skills and an ability to tell compelling stories and articulate the rationale behind your design decisions.
  • Strong sketching skills and can move seamlessly from low-fidelity whiteboard scribbles and paper sketches to high-fidelity mockups and prototypes.
  • Intimately familiar with the latest user-centered design trends and methodologies, setting up and working with design systems.
  • An expert with Figma and/or Sketch and Sketch-related tools (Abstract, Zeplin, InVision), Photoshop, Illustrator, and various other tools.
  • Planning and integrating concepts into a broad range of visual planning/ presentational/ business tools – Miro, Microsoft Office, Google Workspace, etc.
  • Experience with UX project planning tools such as Jira, Trello, Monday.
  • Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, Javascript, JQuery and other front-end markup languages
  • A diverse digital portfolio that shows just how good you are with interaction design, user experience, typography, colors, layouts and images.
  • Design Degree (Visual communication, Graphic Design, Interaction Design or Human Computer Interaction or Anthropology) or equivalent experience/strong portfolio.



Additional Awesomeness:
  • Experience working with multiple design and/or development teams in different time zones
  • UI experience in building, uplifting and/or maintaining a design library of components, demonstrating a strong understanding of patterns and pixel-perfect consistency.
Netomi is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

results.title: Product Designer
results.description:
We’re on the lookout for an experienced product-oriented designer! Sound like your kind of thing? Join an excellent team of motivated design enthusiasts, and turn your day job into something you love. We’ll be happy to check out your portfolio and get back to you!

Who We Are

First, a bit about us. STRV is a software design and engineering team that delivers next-level products. Here since 2004, we’ve delivered solutions for partners ranging from startups to enterprises, including Barry’s, Microsoft, MedMen, Barnes & Noble, The Athletic, Autodesk, and more.

We focus on mobile applications, websites, backend infrastructure, IoT, blockchain, and data science/ML/AI. We have a footprint in specialized domains like dating, crypto, and mobile gaming. On top of that, we’ve also got some successful internal spin-off projects (like Surge and Zoe), with more in the works — including a space western multiplayer NFT game. Feel free to ask us all about them.

The culture is very open and friendly, with everyone on the team self-driven in delivering the highest possible value for clients — because we all care about building partnerships and creating products that make us proud. But you’ve probably scrolled our web and read about all that already. 

How You Fit In

You’ll be joining our Design team and will be working on projects that usually last around 3 months and can involve design, development, QA, and product management. Usually, you can expect to work on only one project at a time and be involved from start to finish.

International Community

A few things to know: STRV people represent about 26 nationalities, so our official language is English. For people that decide to relocate to the Czech Republic, we’re always happy to provide visa sponsorships and relocation support. And as for meeting our US clients, there may be times you’ll get to visit them — or you may see them strolling through our Prague office since they’re often curious to see the STRV in action and to meet their team in person.

Learning & Other Opportunities

With over 9 designers, a team lead and a creative director, there’s always someone to consult, have a design feedback session with and learn from. We also host a couple of meetups and workshops, and our designers have a generous conference budget. The occasional trip to conferences worldwide is absolutely on the table.

And, in line with our knowledge-sharing mindset, we are all working in Figma, where you can see what everybody is working on in real-time.

At STRV, Your Role Will Be To
  • Confidently describe your design solutions to our clients at all levels
  • Be responsible for the whole design output on a given project
  • Collaborate with other designers on projects
  • Perform as a fearless team player, as you’ll also be collaborating with other departments and supporting them until the project is fully finished
  • Provide constructive feedback to other designers to help them move forward
We Expect You To Have
  • A user-centered product design approach
  • A natural drive that will fit in with our always curious, tight-knit team; open, honest communication, and the ability to learn are a must
  • Multiple years of experience in the industry and a mind full of ideas ready to be put into action
  • The ability to start a project with user flows and wireframes, visually perfecting its UI and finishing it by prototyping and presenting to a client independently
  • Experience with Figma
  • Confident English on a high level; due to our primarily US-based clientele, our designers present and consult their work in English
Perks & Benefits

We want you to feel at home. Our benefits help make sure that you remain productive, have all the tools you need, and stay in great shape both mentally and physically. Here’s what we offer:

  • Flexible working hours 
  • MacBook Pro laptop
  • External display, extra charger, and accessories
  • AirPods or alternative headphones
  • Occasional trips to Czech Republic
  • Conferences, meetups, language lessons, seminars to support personal growth
  • Themed events and team buildings to cultivate the spirit of STRV

results.title: 3D Animator Graphic Designer
results.description:
About the 3D Animator position

A 3D animator uses images, figures, and symbols to help bring a brand's concept to life. You will work with a creative graphics team and marketing teams to storyboard and design ideas, translate concepts into moving imagery, and deliver all assets needed to produce the 3D animation.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Communicate with the clients and/or creative director to understand the concept and requirements of a project
  • Draw sketches and develop storyboards according to the script
  • Create 2D models of the sketches in the computer and modify the design if required
  • Work with the creative team for character design and discuss the changes that will enhance the appearance of the sequence as a whole
  • Add background, sound, texture, colors, lighting and other attributes to an animation
  • Create separate frames for each sequence and put the sequence on timeline to match the script and soundtrack
  • Edit and fine tune the animation sequence and ensure that the final product meets the project requirements
  • Other ad hoc tasks

Qualifications and Skills:

  • 2+ years' experience of working as 3D Animator / Graphic Designer or other similar position
  • Excellent graphic design skills with a strong portfolio
  • Creative flair, versatility, conceptual/visual ability and originality
  • Good practical experience with industry leading software and technologies, such as In Design, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, - - Photoshop and so on
  • Strong abilities to comply with requirements of time, costs and deadlines
  • Can work 4 to 6 hours a day following Eastern Standard Time (EST) Schedule

Requirements

As you will be working from home, please be advised that we will require you to prepare certain Technical Requirements for you to meet the industry standard.

  • A dedicated secluded working space away from noise and any distractions
  • Updated personal computer or laptop with webcam
  • Stable internet connection of at least 5Mbps and a backup of a pocket WiFi or Mobile Data
